Package org.blobbase

BlobBase creates an abstract storage mechanism used for mapping keys to binary large objects (BLOB) stored on the file system.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlobBase
    Create an abstract storage mechanism used for mapping keys to binary large objects (BLOB) stored on the file system.
    BlobFile
    A wrapper for the standard Java File class that overrides certain methods that would might cause database problems if they we 'accidentally' invoked and are thus prohibited.
    BlobFileIterator
    A lazily populated iterator for listing files in database.
    FileWithMetadata
    A thin wrapper on top of the java File class to allow the setting of file attributes.

Package org.blobbase Description

BlobBase creates an abstract storage mechanism used for mapping keys to binary large objects (BLOB) stored on the file system. Various methods allow the user to create a manipulate java File objects. There are also helper methods for input and output. The database itself is constructed using the file system. Keys are mapped to files located within the subdirectory structure. This allows the use of standard copy/move commands to be used on the database with no adverse effects.
